title: Why is Israel's army so powerful? - Quora

response.answer_text: My 6 points are below. The most important one is “אין לי ארץ אחרת”. The IDF has mandatory conscription of both men and women at the age of 18. This creates a huge and extremely diverse database. This way the IDF can choose the best soldiers for its top units - and for every slot there is a long line of people. Just to get the statistics - for special forces units the acceptance ratio (number of recruits who requested the unit and did all the tests vs. the one who were accepted) is between 1/20 to 1/50.The reservists are 66% of the total combat manpower. Israel is able to keep relatively small numbers of active units and build on reserve units in case of major conflict. This means that main part of the combat units - in case of war - is based on 30 y/o man, most of them married with kids.All IDF officers have started as a simple soldier and did the same training path as the guys they are in charge of. This actually makes IDF unique among other western armed forces. IDF officer is much better “connected” to his platoon/company/battalion and earns his “trust” through his actions and not by his ranks. They lead by personal example and in front of their troops.IDF is always busy - either by large scale conflicts or continuous anti-terror operations. This yields very rich operational experience and allows quick learning and adaption - in most combat units the majority of the officers have seen “real action” more than once.Troops safety in training is highly important. The number of casualties during training is very low and every single accident is thoroughly investigated.IDF combines unique relationships with US and have enormous investment from the governmental side. Israeli defense budget is 6.2% of the GDP - 4th place after Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates and Russia.So let’s combine the all 6 points. You have soldiers, from ages 18 up to 45, protecting their families, friends and homes. Do you need a better motivation? Most of the key players are experienced officers with rich combat records. And most important - the sense of mission is deep and meaningful. Sources: List of countries by military expenditures - Wikipedia Israel Defense Forces - Wikipedia The Path to Becoming an IDF Soldier
